intro: Bistorta confusa, commonly known as the confused bistorta, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often reddish stems. The plant features basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in summer. Bistorta confusa is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. It is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it contributes to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
